greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest odd prime base q such that p^2 divides q^(p-1) - 1, where p = prime(n).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
W. Keller and J. Richstein, Fermat quotients that are divisible by p.
mathematica: Table[Function[p, q = 3; While[! Divisible[q^(p - 1) - 1, p^2], q = NextPrime@ q]; q]@ Prime@ n, {n, 54}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 12 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {p = prime(n); forprime(q=3, , if (Mod(q, p^2)^(p-1) == 1, return (q)););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 24 2014
xref: Cf. A125637 (analogous with p^3 instead of p^2).
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Nov 28 2006
ext: Removed an incorrect comment. - _Felix Fröhlich_, Feb 12 2017
